abstract: Football coaches Bud Foster of Virginia Tech and Tommy Tuberville of University of Cincinnati add to controversy surrounding new NCAA rule allowing colleges to pay athletes cost-of-attendance stipends when they suggested that players could be fined portions of stipends for behavioral issues; such fines would violate longstanding NCAA rule that financial aid packages may not be reduced or canceled for any sports-related reason.
lead_paragraph: Recent remarks from two prominent coaches revealed that confusion still exists about how to treat athletes who are ostensibly amateurs and yet now receive checks from their teams.

headline.main: Fines for College Football Players? Not So Fast
headline.print_headline: As Players Receive Cash, Threats of Fines Seem to Contradict N.C.A.A. Rules

snippet: Recent remarks from two prominent coaches revealed that confusion still exists about how to treat athletes who are ostensibly amateurs and yet now receive checks from their teams.
